Articles.Content:
Yeah,  I know, "yet another mission logger", but I still wanted to take a shot at it

This is a locally hosted, Django based mission logger for KSP.

GitHub page with readme and instructions: https://github.com/DeepSpace2/ksp-mission-logger

If configured correctly (explained in the readme) it will import all your vessels' names from KSP to the vessel selection menu.

License is MIT.

Any feedback will be welcomed

 

Edited May 7, 2016 by DeepSpace

Not a bad start. Having it local is nice. I would think it'd be better if missions were things that contained multiple logs and ships. So one could have some mission called "bacon-is-delicous" as the name, then perhaps two ships, "baconator-1" and "baconator-2" and one just then adds events related to a mission. (If this wasn't a strict tree structure and instead events could be tagged as being part of multiple missions that'd be even better, so you could have a refuelling mission to some station and then the refuelling event could be recorded as belonging to both the mission that's being refuelled and the station's associated mission.)

Edit: Also some way to delete ships.

Edited June 5, 2016 by phoenix_ca
